Steps.Message: Update at 19:03 - Hi, this is Demi from the UK Power Networks messaging team. Thanks for your patience over tonight. Our engineers have been in contact to let us know that we can now confirm that the power is off due to a damaged cable caused by another company, which triggered our substation safety equiment. We have also had to isolate further supplies to allow safe repairs. To give them time to complete their work to the cable safely, the estimated timeframe to restore your power is now between 21:30 and 22:30. We're sorry this is taking longer than expected, and we'll continue to keep you up to date, but if any change to this time comes in from our staff I'll let you know as soon as we hear.

We became aware of a power cut at 16:21. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly.
Steps.Name: Power cut reported

Steps.Message: We have engineers on their way. As this is affecting your area, they will not need to attend your property. Rest assured once they arrive, they’ll work as quickly as is safely possible to get your power back on.
Steps.Name: Engineers on their way

Steps.Message: Engineers are now on site, carrying out investigations into the fault. Once they have completed their assessment, they will carry out repairs.
Steps.Name: Engineers investigating and fixing

To give them time to complete their work to the cable safely, the estimated timeframe to restore your power is now between 21:30 and 22:30. We're sorry this is taking longer than expected, and we'll continue to keep you up to date, but if any change to this time comes in from our staff I'll let you know as soon as we hear.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: We were investigating an electricity cable that was damaged, causing a power cut in the local area.
